articles.title: Korean Documentary Film Screened
articles.content:
Korean Documentary Film Screened
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- A Korean documentary film "Fatherly General Is among Service Personnel" was screened at the People's Palace of Culture on Wednesday on the occasion of the 24th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army (KPA).
					 The film shows the fact that Kim Jong Il went among the service personnel till the last moments of his life since he started his Songun revolutionary leadership, developing the KPA into the matchless elite army and turning the country into the world's military power.
					
					 It also deals with the leadership and big efforts of Kim Jong Il who made the long journey of Songun leadership nonstop from one front to another by visiting the frontline standing guard over the country.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party and state officials, the chairperson of a friendly party and officials of ministries and national institutions.

articles.title: Mozambican President Calls for Developing Relations with DPRK
articles.content:
Mozambican President Calls for Developing Relations with DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Minister of Public Health of the DPRK Kang Ha Guk, who is leading a DPRK government delegation on a visit to Mozambique, met and had a talk with Filipe Nwussi, president of the Republic of Mozambique, at the presidential palace on December 18.
					 The Mozambican president expressed deep thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un for sending the DPRK government delegation with much importance attached to the development of bilateral relations. He went on:
					
					 The relations between the two countries, provided by President Kim Il Sung and HE Kim Jong Il, the great leaders of Korea, and the preceding leaders of Mozambique, are special relations with a long history.
					
					 Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il rendered unsparing support for the independence and building of a new society of Mozambique and the Mozambican government and people boundlessly revere Kim Il Sung, President of the Korean people, evidenced by the existence of Kim Il Sung Street in the centre of Maputo city.
					
					 The Mozambican president said that he would make all efforts to further develop the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation which were cultivated by the preceding leaders of the two countries, and he sincerely congratulated the DPRK government on gaining great successes in the work of building an economic power and improving the people's standard of living under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter to Kim Jong Un from Military Attaches Corps
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and a congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the occasion of the 24th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army.
					 They were handed over to an official concerned by Military, Naval and Air Attache of the Chinese embassy here Zhang Ping who is doyen of the corps on Wednesday.
					
					 Meanwhile, a floral basket and a congratulatory letter to Kim Jong Un from Brazilian Ambassador to the DPRK Roberto Colin were conveyed to an official concerned on the same day.

articles.title: Rangrim Revolutionary Battle Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
articles.content:
Rangrim Revolutionary Battle Site Draws Endless Stream of Visitors
 Rangrim, December 23 (KCNA) -- Service personnel, people of various strata and school youths and children visit the Rangrim Revolutionary Battle Site every day on the occasion of the 98th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. The battle site is associated with her revolutionary exploits. 
					 The Insan area of the battle site is where she conducted revolutionary activities in August, Juche 26 (1937) to carry out the strategic policy advanced by President Kim Il Sung on expanding the anti-Japanese national liberation struggle into the whole country. 
					
					 There she guided meetings of heads of small units and groups of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and underground revolutionary organizations.
					
					 She also firmly built secret camps at important places of Rangrim Range, revolutionized its surrounding areas, expanded underground organizations and steadily supplement the ranks of small units, true to the intention of Kim Il Sung. Meanwhile, she organized the work of supporting the Korean People's Revolutionary Army.
					
					 While staying in a farmer's house in Turungbong one night, she told about the legendary stories about Kim Il Sung and aroused the fire-field peasants into anti-Japanese patriotic struggle.
					
					 The visitors laid bouquets and flowers before a mosaic depicting her image and made bows.
					
					 They looked round a log cabin in the valley of Turungbong, Jinhung night school, inn, water mill, etc.

articles.title: Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
articles.content:
Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace in Pyongyang was splendidly remodeled to be an embodiment of the loving care of the Workers' Party of Korea for coming generations and the Juche-based idea on architectural aesthetics.
					 The exterior of the palace is covered with granite and high-quality building materials, giving the impression of grandeur to visitors.
					
					 Seen in the main hall of the palace are a large relief Korean map and a model of the carrier-rocket "Unha-3".
					
					 The palace has many rooms for schoolchildren to learn computer, physics, embroidery, singing, musical instruments, etc. with 2,000-seat theater, swimming pool and various sports facilities.
					
					 It has also a luxurious dormitory for schoolchildren from different parts of the country.
					
					 The palace is an edifice which no other country can build or imitate and a monumental one demonstrating the advantageous socialist system in the DPRK.

articles.title: National Sports Records Renewed in DPRK This Year
articles.content:
National Sports Records Renewed in DPRK This Year
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Athletes of the DPRK have set a lot of new national records in various sports events this year.
					 According to data available, 19 new records were set at the Mangyongdae Prize Sports Games in April, the Sports Contest for Pochonbo Torch Prize in June and the DPRK Championships in Sept.-Nov.
					
					 Such renewal of national records was witnessed mainly in the weightlifting event.
					
					 For instance, weightlifters of the April 25 Sports Team renewed the previous records in men's 85kg snatch and jerk and women's 48kg jerk and above 75kg snatch while a weightlifter of the February 8 Vinalon Complex Sports Team set a new record in women's 48kg snatch. Ri Jun from the Pyongyang Sports Team broke the existing record in men's 94kg jerk in April and set a new record in snatch in November.
					
					 In June and October the Defense Sports Team of the Korean People's Army renewed records in women's individual 50m 3-position rifle shooting and set new records in men's team skeet shooting and 50m running target mixed shooting and in women's team 50m 3-position rifle shooting.
					
					 New records were also made in swimming, field and track, speed skating and other events.

articles.title: No Sanctions and Pressure Can Browbeat DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No Sanctions and Pressure Can Browbeat DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The United States put the DPRK's armed forces, munitions and trade institutions and officials and even diplomats on the list of sanctions. This clearly prove the American empire has become all the more undisguised in its anachronistic policy hostile to the DPRK, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The DPRK-U.S. confrontation has lasted seven decades. Still the U.S. does not know that the army and people of the DPRK would never be browbeaten by any such pressure and sanctions. 
					
					 One who is unaware of its rival is bound to ruin.
					
					 The gangster-like U.S. imperialists, oblivious of their pitiful plight, resort to reckless hostile moves against the DPRK out of their inveterate repugnancy toward it, only to plunge into the abyss of inescapable destruction.
					
					 The unreasonable U.S. sanctions will only heighten the spirit of self-reliance of the working people of the DPRK, make them redouble their efforts and boost the proportion of the use of locally available raw and other materials of our industry.
					
					 The DPRK has nothing to be afraid of thanks to the firm foundation of  the self-supporting national economy provided by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il all their lives and the Workers' Party of Korea' strategic line on simultaneously pushing forward economic construction and the building of a nuclear force. 
					
					 The spirit of self-reliance striking terror into the enemies will be further displayed on this land.

articles.title: U.S. Should Sit in Dock at Human Rights Tribunal: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Should Sit in Dock at Human Rights Tribunal: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Politicians of the U.S. bluff America is "society equal for all" and that racism disappeared in it while the bourgeois venal media-persons call the U.S. a "model of free world."  However, their loudmouthed "equality for all" is nothing but a camouflage for realizing their political ambition. "Disappearance of racism" is also a sheer lie. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a commentary. 
					
					 There are a great number of jobless and homeless people in the U.S. and all kinds of crimes including murder and robbery stalk the country, the commentary says, and goes on:
					
					 There are more than 200 countries and regions in the world and the U.S. tops the world's list of worst human rights abusers as all sorts of racial crimes have become endemic in it and the police kill defenseless people at random. 
					
					 The U.S. is the worst hell and tundra of human rights in the world where the colored people are subject to discrimination and contempt under the fear of getting shot to death any moment. Racial contradiction has reached the brink of explosion in the land plagued by misanthropy and indiscriminate murder. 
					
					 The U.S. recognized as the worst human rights abuser by the international community should stop acting a "human rights judge", set right the grave human rights issue in the country, to begin with, and sit in the dock at a human rights tribunal of its own accord.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses U.S. Trick behind Its Call for Deployment of THAAD in S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses U.S. Trick behind Its Call for Deployment of THAAD in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Recently, an American non-governmental research organization held a seminar on the theme of "missile defence in Pacific" at U.S. Congress.
					Its director general said THAAD serves as the most effective means for defending south Korea from "missile threats from north Korea".
					
					A senior researcher of another U.S. non-governmental research organization, the former director of the Missile Defense Agency of the U.S. Defense Department and several other experts also called THAAD a package system capable of holding back north Korea's missiles with diverse missions, underscoring the need to deploy it in south Korea.
					
					Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says in a commentary in this regard:
					
					This is part of cunning information campaign aimed to deploy THAAD in south Korea at any cost by making the international community immune to it.
					
					The relations between the U.S. and the neighboring countries of the DPRK are those among competitive rivals who can not compromise not only in politics and economy but in military affairs.
					
					The neighboring countries are building up their muscle to neutralize the domination of the U.S. over the Asia-Pacific region while bolstering up their military capabilities in high speed, actually displaying influences in the region in no small measure.
					
					So the U.S. military upper-hand is sinking like a setting sun.
					
					Lurking behind the public opinion being built up over the need to deploy THAAD in south Korea is the ulterior purpose to ensure military superiority by spying out all the military movement of competitive rivals and taking preliminary measures.
					
					The U.S. complaint about the DPRK's "missile threats" is nothing but a pretext to justify the deployment of THAAD in south Korea.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Ambition to Grab Tok Islet Assailed
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Ambition to Grab Tok Islet Assailed
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Supra-partisan lawmakers belonging to the "Dietmen's League for Defending Japanese Territory" recently visited the Marine Intelligence Department of the Coast Guard Agency of Japan to check the preservation of the ordnance map of Tok Islet drawn in 1908. The map drawn by the Department of the Japanese Navy Waterway, predecessor of the Marine Intelligence Department, reportedly shows topographical details and directions on Tok Islet including its altitude. 
					 What is ridiculous is that the acting chairman of the Policy Research Council of the Liberal Democratic Party of Japan who doubles as chairman of the above-said league talked rubbish that the map is "valuable evidence" proving that Tok Islet is part of the territory of Japan. 
					
					 The said map is no more than a worthless one, says Minju Joson Wednesday in a commentary. 
					
					 Citing facts to prove that Tok Islet was first discovered by the ancestors of Korea and has historically been used by Koreans, the commentary goes on:
					
					 The Japanese Shimane Prefectural government promulgated that Tok Islet came under the administrative control of the prefecture in 1905 when the Japanese imperialists' moves for aggression of Korea got into full swing following the deprivation of Korea of its sovereignty through the fabrication of the "Ulsa (1905) Five-point Treaty."
					
					 This proves that Japan's first claim to "dominium over Tok Islet" was the extension and product of the Japanese imperialists' moves for invading Korea. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries justify Japan's crime-woven history and insist that Tok Islet belongs to it. Their shameless behavior shows that their wild ambition for aggression of Korea remains unchanged. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries should stop at once the foolish act of having an eye on other's territory, bearing deep in mind that their ambition to grab Tok Islet is a daydream.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Blasted for Trying to Shift Responsibility for Stalled Talks on to DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Blasted for Trying to Shift Responsibility for Stalled Talks on to DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The south side which had been keen on shifting the blame for the breakdown of the north-south authorities' talks on to the DPRK, soon after the release of the statement of a spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea, talked such rubbish that the DPRK "unilaterally distorted the results of the talks" which is "regretful" and that the talks broke down as the "north insisted on the resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang to get benefits".
					 On Dec. 17, Minister of Unification Hong Yong Phyo, in reference to the rupture of the talks, said "must-principles can never be violated" and "it is unlikely to agree on the resumption of the tour of Mt. Kumgang in return for the solution to the issue of separated families".
					
					 A commentary of Minju Joson Wednesday brands this as a revelation of the sinister intention to shift the responsibility for the rupture of the talks on to the DPRK and justify the confrontation moves.
					
					 The south side, in wanton violation of the agreement made at technical contact for the north-south authorities' talks, deliberately created difficulties and obstacles and categorically rejected the discussion of issues, which were agreed at the technical contact, intentionally pushing the talks to a rupture, the news analyst says, and goes on:
					
					 It is the height of impudence that the south side has gone desperate in its moves to shift the blame on to the DPRK while misleading the public opinion to make it believe that the "north insisted on the resumption of the tour to get some benefits". The south Korean authorities' sycophantic treachery of submitting to the U.S. to solve even national issues with the "approval" of the U.S. has been one of the reasons that plunged the authorities' talks into a stalemate.
					
					 The south Korean conservative ruling forces have not discarded their inveterate concept of escalating confrontation with fellow countrymen. Yet, they trumpet about the resumption of the talks which is little short of a treacherous act of mocking the nation.

articles.title: Dictatorial Politics Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Dictatorial Politics Slammed in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- South Koreans from all walks of life insisted on intensifying solidarity and unity against the dictatorial rule of the conservative authorities, according to Voice of People, an internet newspaper of south Korea.
					 An inaugural ceremony of the Forum of Politics for Democracy and Reunification took place in Seoul on Dec. 20, involving people of various strata like intellectuals, religionists, students including those from over 150 organizations and civic and public circles.
					
					 Speakers said that the forum is aimed to found a new political party for progress with the people's seizure of power and realization of democracy as its mission and also to conduct activities to halt the revival of "yusin" dictatorship, secure the right to existence, exterminate pro-Japanese elements, pursue national reconciliation and achieve peaceful reunification, integration and solidarity.

articles.title: General Strike Called for in S. Korea
articles.content:
General Strike Called for in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- The south Korea Solidarity for Independent Reunification and Democracy made public a statement titled "Let's put an end to Park Geun Hye through general strike, all-out action!" on Dec. 19.
					 The three years of office of the present chief executive through election rigging have been days in hell for the masses, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Household debt has steadily increased and retrogressive revision of labor law and the conclusion of FTA with outsiders have deteriorated the lives of workers and peasants.
					
					 The truth about the ferry Sewol disaster has not been probed though 600 days have passed since then.
					
					 The regime pushed the hard-won south-north authorities' talks to a rupture.
					
					 It is cracking down on general strike by the use of all suppression means after designating the people as "terrorists."
					
					 The regime and the "Saenuri Party" defined the present situation in which the bill on labor reform, bill on economy, bill against terrorism and "bill on human rights in the north" have not been passed as "emergency".
					
					 The statement called for a strong action to put an end to the undemocratic and unpopular regime.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Uganda
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Uganda
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Cause of the Great Party of Comrades Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Is Ever-Victorious" was published in booklet by a publishing house in Kampala, Uganda on December 17.
					 The work, published on October 4, Juche 104 (2015), clarifies the idea that the seven decade-long history of the Workers' Party of Korea is the proud one of victory which demonstrated the validity and invincibility of the cause of the party of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and that the sacred cause of the party is always sure to triumph.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Guinean, Syrian Figures
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Guinean, Syrian Figures
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Figures of Guinea and Syria issued statements on Dec. 15 and 17 on the occasion of the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Banou Keita, chairman of the Guinea-Korea Friendship Association, said that Kim Jong Il turned the DPRK into a political, ideological and military power which nobody dares provoke by developing and enriching the Juche idea and Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and thoroughly applying them to the revolution and construction.
					
					 He stressed that Kim Jong Il directed big efforts to the development of the relations with the countries aspiring after independence and waged energetic external activities in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, thus dynamically propelling the cause of global independence.
					
					 The chairman noted that his revolutionary idea and exploits will go down forever.
					
					 Saber Ballul, head of the Department of the Political Faculty of University of Damascus of Syria, praised Kim Jong Il as the tender-hearted father of the Korean people, a peerlessly outstanding leader and the greatest man who made contributions to the Korean revolution and the cause of human independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Russian Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Russian Media
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Russian media dedicated special write-ups to the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Media carried portraits of smiling leader Kim Jong Il and his photos, and a photo of Kim Jong Il standing together with Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The Dec. 9th issue of the newspaper Rio Panorama said in an article titled "The whole life for the future" that Kim Jong Il dedicated his all to the future of the DPRK true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The newspaper Vladivostok on Dec. 9 carried an article titled "Honoring the memory of Comrade Kim Jong Il".
					
					 The Korean people have held him in high esteem as the eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and added shine to his exploits. These are a reflection of their noblest moral obligation and loyalty to him who made special contributions to the building of a thriving socialist nation and the cause of human independence.
					
					 The Korean people have made great changes in all fields and spheres of society by accelerating the dynamic advance to carry out his behests.
					
					 The Dec. 11th issue of the newspaper Byvor carried an article titled "Eternal chairman of NDC of the DPRK. The article said that he established the state machinery with the NDC as a pivot and provided a firm legal guarantee for the Songun politics and thus laid the foundations for the DPRK to prosper forever.
					
					 The Irkutsk website in an article on Dec. 5 said that the Korean people had carried out his behests without an inch of deflection, keeping boundless reverence and invariable loyalty to him for the past four years.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary Observed by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Foreign media carried reports to observe the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 An Indonesian news agency said in an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il, for Korea's reunification" on Dec. 16:
					
					 H.E. Kim Jong Il wisely led the cause of building the state and the cause of national reunification all his life, true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 He visited the monument inscribed with Kim Il Sung's signature erected in Panmunjom and made a firm resolution to carry out his cause of national reunification.
					
					 He formulated the three principles of national reunification and the ten-point programme of the great unity of the whole nation and the proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo set forth by the President as the three charters for national reunification.
					
					 He made sure that the north-south summit in June, 2000, for the first time in the history of division of the Korean nation, was provided and the June 15 joint declaration was adopted.
					
					 The Dec. 12th issue of the Nigerian newspaper Nigerian Observer said in an article titled "Immortal exploits for peace" that the exploits of Chairman of the National Defence Commission Kim Jong Il will go down forever in history as he beat back the imperialists' aggression, high-handed and arbitrary practices and safeguarded peace and security with his unique Songun politics.
					
					 The Senegalese newspaper Le Populaire and state radio broadcasting service said on Dec. 17 that the Korean people added shine to the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il and thoroughly carried out his behests for the past four years after his demise.

articles.title: Russian Figures Visit DPRK Missions in Russia
articles.content:
Russian Figures Visit DPRK Missions in Russia
 Pyongyang, December 23 (KCNA) -- Russian personages of various circles visited the DPRK missions in Russia on Dec. 17, the fourth anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They included the chairwoman of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, the vice-director of the International Relations Department of the United Russia Party, director of the International Affairs Department of the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, the vice-director of the International Affairs Department of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, a secretary of the Khabarovsk Territorial Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK, the director of the Forum Book Publishing House of Russia and the head of the Orchestra of the 21st Century. They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the photo and pictures showing President Kim Il Sung standing together with Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 Sazhi Umalatova, chairperson of the Party for Peace and Unity of Russia, said:
					
					 All the members of our party are paying the noblest tribute to Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 4th anniversary of his demise.
					
					 It is our obligation to always remember him in our hearts.
					
					 Pavel Ovsyannikov, head and chief conductor of the Orchestra of the 21st Century of Russia, said that he could never forget the kind image of Kim Jong Il. He added that Kim Jong Il, the greatest man recognized by the world, will always be alive in our hearts.

articles.title: Proyectado documental dedicado a 24 de diciembre
articles.content:
Proyectado documental dedicado a 24 de diciembre
Pyongyang, 23 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 24o aniversario del nombramiento (24 de diciembre) del Dirigente Kim Jong Il como Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, fue proyectado el dia 23 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el documental coreano intitulado "El Dirigente Kim Jong Il entre los oficiales y soldados del Ejercito Popular".
					Lo vieron Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado, el presidente de partido amigo y los funcionarios de los ministerios y los organos centrales.
					
					El filme muestra las proezas del Dirigente quien desde el inicio de la direccion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun hasta el ultimo tiempo de su vida estuvo siempre entre los oficiales y soldados del EPC mientras que convirtio el Ejercito Popular en las poderosas fuerzas armadas y llevo la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea a la posicion de la potencia militar de talla mundial.
					
					La pelicula demuestra la direccion y la abnegacion del Dirigente quien continuo la direccion mediante el Songun estando siempre en la primera linea del frente para la defensa de la patria.
